job_description:
We’re looking for people who put their innovation to work to advance our success – and their own. Join an organization that ensures a more secure world through connecting and protecting our customers with inventive electrical solutions.

WHAT YOU WILL EXPERIENCE IN THIS POSITION:
• Build, update and/or maintain customer and supplier master data in core technology platforms (e.g., ERP, Salesforce, etc.) based on requests submitted from the business
• Supervise and follow up on incomplete requests to drive prompt completion of open items
• Ensure work instructions for the setup and maintenance of customer and supplier master data are current and accurate
• Research, analyze and help resolve complex data requests, with support from the team manager as needed
• Work with multi-functional (e.g., Inside Sales, Purchasing/Planning, Controlling) to review and clean up existing master data by performing and supervising required action items
• Assist in the completion of required compliance activities related to nVent’s third-party financial control environment
• Maintain key ERP databases, based on the requirements of the different business segments supported
• Actively participate in nVent’s global master data implementation and maintenance, as well as other technology initiatives involving customer and supplier master data
• Assist in the collection and submission of data as part of any internal or external audit requests
• Enforce to all nVent internal controls, policies and procedures as part of the supplier and customer set up process
• Work together with nVent Compliance to improve processes surrounding compliance requirements embedded in master data information.

YOU HAVE:
• Academic background of Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree
• Previous experience:
• 3+ years working with customers, products, sales orders/invoicing, purchasing. Any work in master data administration, customer service, purchasing/planning or finance is relevant.
• ERP system experience required, such as SAP, Infor M3, or JD Edwards
• Experience in operational process management – maintaining, improving and communicating business processes consistently
• Experience in a publicly-traded company preferred
• Skills:
• Intermediate or advanced knowledge of MS Excel and Windows based software (PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, etc.).
• Technical capability and/or open to learn new software/applications is highly desired
• Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work closely across functional and organizational teams in other countries with good communication skills.
• Strong organizational and problem solving skills with attention to detail.
• Fluency in English

WE HAVE:
• A dynamic global reach with diverse operations around the world that will stretch your abilities, provide plentiful career opportunities, and allow you to make an impact every day
• At nVent, we connect and protect a more sustainable and electrified world with inventive electrical solutions. We’re a nearly $3 billion high-performance electrical company with a dedicated team of 10,000+ people at more than 130 sites around the world. Our solutions deliver value to industrial, commercial, residential, energy and infrastructure customers, providing mission critical solutions that improve performance, lower costs and reduce downtime.
• We design, manufacture, market, install and service high-performance products and solutions that connect and protect mission critical equipment, buildings and essential processes. Our robust portfolio of leading electrical product brands dates back more than 100 years and includes nVent CADDY, ERICO, HOFFMAN, RAYCHEM, SCHROFF and TRACER.
• Commitment to strengthen communities where our employees live and work
• We encourage and support the philanthropic activities of our employees worldwide
• Through our nVent in Action matching program, we provide funds to nonprofit and educational organizations where our employees volunteer or donate money
• Core values that shape our culture and drive us to deliver the best for our employees and our customers. We’re known for being:
• Innovative & adaptable
• Dedicated to absolute integrity
• Focused on the customer first
• Respectful and team oriented
• Optimistic and energizing
• Accountable for performance
• Benefits to support the lives of our employees

At nVent, we connect and protect our customers with inventive electrical solutions. People are our most valuable asset. Inclusion and diversity means that we celebrate and encourage each other’s authenticity because we understand that uniqueness sparks growth.

#LI-MG1

#LI-Onsite

job_description:
Overview

Emerge is seeking a
Data Analyst to work with our client who is a technology company with a public
safety mission. Through relentless innovation and discovery, they are
strengthening trust, safety, and transparency across the student transportation
space and making the trip to and from school safer for students.

As
part of the broader Data team encompassing data engineering, data
visualization, and data science, the Data Analyst will be responsible for
leveraging our data to help solve business challenges. You will partner closely
with our Product organization and be an integral part of the teams accountable
for optimizing and re-architecting our internal and external customer journeys.
You will be directly responsible for helping the team to understand performance
and efficacy of new features, and the backend supporting those features, while
also collaborating to ideate on their evolution. As an expert on our internal
data set, you will be a chief point of contact for complex analysis projects
which you will own from start to finish. This role works directly with the
business, understanding what needs to be asked and the best way to provide
information and define business metrics. You will also help support existing
reporting through checks, updates, and routine maintenance.

Job Responsibilities
• Understand needs across multiple tiers (e.g. product, operations, logistics, business strategy, program management, and engineering)
• Build deep knowledge of relevant internal and external data repositories
• Work collaboratively with the Product team to design measurement plans and test and learn strategies to iterate on feature development rapidly
• Own the dialogue around the learnings from these tests, making recommendations is key - not just describing the output
• Conduct exploratory analyses, both open-ended and targeted, and translate these into meaningful and insightful information for business users via appropriate tools
• Respond to ad hoc requests for information and analyses and be able to use your knowledge and intuition to highlight what is important and/or questionable
• Use data and programming skills to transform and manipulate data sources as needed
• Understand stakeholder needs and translate them; understand what consumers are asking for, where to find data and deliver it in a consumable way
• Work with sometimes unstructured or inconsistent data and understand how it is generated

Qualifications
• Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Information Systems, or equivalent experience
• 2+ years previous experience
serving on an Analytics team, particularly focused on product-related
metrics like customer experience, feature performance, and website
analytics
• 2+ years of experience writing
complex SQL queries
• Proficient in Python and Data
Analysis
• Demonstrated ability to
communicate effectively with all project stakeholders, including executive
leadership, business subject area leaders, and project staff
• Strong business acumen and
ability to quickly understand what is important to the business and when
results look incorrect
• Ability to work sometimes without clear direction in times of uncertainty and ambiguity
• Understanding of data
extraction mechanisms, data warehousing, and ETL concepts
• Strong analytical,
troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills in data-related projects
• Experience with data
visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Mode, or Power BI

Work
Environment
• Remote; work from home
role
• Monday-Friday work
week, 8-5pm Eastern or Central Time

Emerge seeks, in all its operations, to employ individuals for
available positions based on their qualifications, working knowledge, and
competency. Emerge has a continuing commitment to ensure that fair and equal
employment opportunities are extended to all qualified persons without regard
to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin,
ethnicity, alienage, citizenship or immigration status, age, mental or physical
disability, medical condition, pregnancy, military/veteran status, predisposing
genetic characteristics, familial status, marital status, domestic violence
victim status, or based on their relationship or association with members of a
protected class or any other protected classification, in accordance with
applicable federal, state and local laws.. Emerge is committed to diversity in
its most inclusive sense.

By
completing an application with us, you seek to join a team of hardworking
professionals dedicated to consistently deliver outstanding service to our
customers and contribute to the financial success of the organization, its clients,
and its employees. Equal access to programs, services and employment is
available to all qualified persons. Those applicants requiring accommodation to
complete the application and/or interview process should contact our Emerge
Recruitment Office.

job_description:
The KYC Operations Analyst 2 is an intermediate-level position responsible for Anti-Money Laundering (AML) monitoring, governance, oversight and regulatory reporting activities in coordination with the Compliance and Control team. The overall objective of this role is to develop and manage a dedicated internal KYC (Know Your Client) program at Citi.

Responsibilities:
• Conduct client profile reviews for customer accounts
• Review all information and documentation ensuring compliance with local regulation and Citi standards
• Update KYC forms and client profiles according to policy requirements
• Follow up with clients to ensure information is received before due dates
• Perform KYC tasks, including monitoring and tracking of the KYC records and Appendix approval process, assisting with the development and execution of action planning for expiring records, and ensuring records are not past due
• Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:
• 0-2 years of relevant experience
• Experience in banking operations, preferably in the client account opening and pre-requirements process

Education:
• Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience

Actividades:
• Realizar consultas y análisis de información de bases de datos con millones de registros.
• Elaborar, analizar y presentar reportes de métricas e indicadores clave dentro del área.
• Participar en actividades de coordinación con otras aéreas dentro de la empresa a nivel Local y Global (por ejemplo, tecnología, compliance, data quality e incidentes) para analizar los datos y su remediación.
• Analizar las métricas rojas dentro del proceso de Data Quality Monitoring y ser capaz de explicar la causa raíz de las incidencias detectadas.
• Capacidad de implementar soluciones junto con otros equipos para que la métrica vuelva a valores aceptables.
• Llevar a cabo los reportes de remediaciones masivas dentro del área y su ejecución de las mismas cuando sea necesario.

Habilidades y competencias:
• Experiencia relevante en análisis de información y manejo de bases de datos relacionales.
• Conocimiento en paquetería de Microsoft Office principalmente conocimientos sólidos en Excel y Access (tablas dinámicas, consultas e importación de datos).
• Solución de problemas y capacidad analítica.
• Proactividad y trabajo orientado a resultados.
• Comunicación asertiva.
• Trabajo en equipo bajo esquemas no tradicionales.
• Adaptación al cambio y buena organización para trabajar en un modelo de trabajo hibrido, presencial y home office.

Competencias adicionales (DESEABLES):
• Lenguaje SQL
• Conocimiento en Macros (VBA)
• Conocimiento en lenguajes de programación estructurados y orientados a objetos, como por ejemplo, R, Python, Java, C++.
• Cognos, Power BI, Tableau
• Inglés intermedio/avanzado hablado y escrito.

------------------------------------------------------

Job Family Group:
Compliance and Control

------------------------------------------------------

Job Family:
Business KYC

------------------------------------------------------

Time Type:
Full time

------------------------------------------------------

Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.

job_description:
Job Description

About this job

The Consumer-Packaged Goods space is transforming as more consumers shop online. NielsenIQ is committed to developing a stable, sustainable, and comprehensive U.S. Omnichannel measurement and insights solution. The Operations Data Analyst plays a vital role in delivering a customized Omnichannel solution to our clients.

Responsibilities
• Create the technical design and systems development to ensure requirements are met.
• Work proactively and collaboratively to ensure and validate that the output back from operational algorithms meets the client business requirements.
• Review and manage ongoing database change requests.
• Serve as the contact person for execution teams if database questions arise.
• Provide consultation and support to Program Management on custom Omnichannel solutions and implementation.
• Design and test front end solutions for internal operational teams to manage new tools and solutions.
• Meet with internal clients to understand their needs/requirements and educate on product capabilities.

Qualifications

About You

They will be responsible for translating our clients’ business requirements into operational and executable strategies. This includes a combination of technical implementation, operational quality and stability, and collaboration and communication with Commercial teams.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's Degree: Engineering, Math, Statistics, Economics, and Operations Research.
• +1 year of experience.
• Required: Experience in developing SQL databases and writing applications to interface with SQL databases
• Understanding of Machine Learning concepts
• Python development experience
• Knowledge of NielsenIQ products, industry, and technology
• Experience working in e-commerce, online retail, or digital content sales.

Additional Information

Our Benefits
• Flexibleworking environment
• Health insurance
• Parental leave
• Life assurance
• Volunteer time off

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™.

NIQ, is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit NIQ.com.

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide.

Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/

NIQ or any of our subsidiaries will never ask you for money at any point of the recruitment or onboarding process.

job_description:
• We require that the candidate is fluent in Spanish and currently resides in the LATAM region, as it's important be willing to work under the Mexican Central Time Zone.

   About your mission at Baubap

The Senior Data Analyst works transversally with Customer Success team to capitalize on customer information in order to ensure a memorable experience and product improvements. The role contributes to identifying and building management tools to solve customer problems efficiently.

It also comprises the development of data models that inform the performance of these teams and their impact on the quality of customer experience, by connecting service insights with product and business metrics.

   Outcomes
• Business impact: Connect service and experience metrics with business drivers to understand how service quality and customer experience are related to product usage, creating intermediate metrics such as Contact ratio and transactional NPS.
• Customer Success performance: Build service metrics that allow to understand quality of service in interactions with our clients. This involves the development and adjustment of measurement models for Incoming and Outgoing volume, SLAs, Backlog, Productivity, Time-bound metrics, among other service metrics.
• Measuring and deriving insights from OKRs: Design and build dashboards that inform OKR progress of Customer Success, allowing fast decision-making for the short, medium and long-term. It also delivers insights based on data trends and relationship between metrics.
• Performance projection (Staffing): Make use of data models for performance and headcount forecasting that allow us to adjust team performance and organization to respond to seasonality and trends in volume metrics (Incoming, Outgoing and Backlog).
• Build and/or improve models for measuring Customer Success: Define use of metrics such as NPS, CSAT, CES through the customer journey. Create insights based on this information and the voice of the customer to inform priorities and decision-making around the product
• Propose implementations that enable service automation and process optimization. Understand the quantitative impact that this generates on the quality of service and experience, understand the business needs, and always prioritize customer success.
• Measurement of initiatives: Support in the measurement of initiatives proposed by Customer Success, ensuring significant representative sampling, the proper use of statistical models, and the correct implementation of A/B testing.
• Understand different needs of the Head of Customer Success, and contribute effectively to solve them. This might include hypothesis testing, dashboard creation, or development of tools that impact directly or indirectly the customer experience

   Day to Day
• As part of the Customer Success team, you will be working closely with all members to understand and resolve data needs aligned with Strategy and the vision of the Head of Customer Success.
• Translate complex data into understandable conclusions for a business and service audience, and propose potential actions and strategies.
• Constantly finding insights through extensive analysis of raw data from Customer Success tools, so the Head of Customer Success can make informed decisions about product development.
• Measure and articulate the business impact of changes, improvements and/or experiments.

   Requirements
• Strong statistical and analytical background at minimum 4 years of experience
• Proficiency in SQL - Advanced Level 4+ years of experience
• Proficiency in Python - Intermediate Level +2 years of experience
• Experience in CX teams + 2years of experience
• Experience in reporting to a non-technical audience and experience using data visualization tools
• Conversational English Level
• Startup experience

   Nice to have
• Experience in FinTech
• Experience in E-commerce

   Your skills
• Clear and transparent communication. You are able to express your thoughts clearly, concisely and to the point. You can openly discuss any blockers you have, and constructively point out areas for improvement.
• Relentlessly resourceful at execution and problem solving. You make things happen, no matter what. You are disciplined, organized and systematically follow through on your work. Instead of getting stuck thinking "well, this doesn't work", you look for creative / innovative / outside-of-the-box solutions to fix the issue and move on.
• Sense of urgency. You operate with a constant sense of urgency (as if there was a large, hungry wolf chasing you), constantly looking for ways to move ahead and push everything around you to get to your desired outcome in the most efficient and productive way. You don’t wait around and make things happen.
• Flexibility / adaptability / resilience. You can maintain your composure and focus despite the constantly changing environment, and adequately adapt to new conditions. You can swiftly change the course of action when needed, and you don't get easily demotivated.
• Being self-driven / committed. You require very little guidance and intervention from your leader to move ahead. You can correctly read what the situation requires, and take the necessary action accordingly. If your leader were to disappear, you can still move ahead and make relevant things happen. You act because you want to, and not because someone else is telling you that you should.
• Critical / analytical thinking. You can correctly analyze the root causes of a problem, without getting side-tracked by irrelevant, minor details. You can come to the right conclusion and propose a clear, logical plan of action. You don't stay on the surface of things.

   What we can offer you
• Being part of a multinational, highly driven team of professionals
• Remote working environment
• High level of ownership and independence
• 20 vacation days / year + 75% holiday bonus
• 1 month (proportional) of Christmas bonus
• Food vouchers 3,257.10 MXN / month
• Health & Life insurance
• Paid time-off Parental Leave
• Home office set-up budget
• Unlimited budget for Kindle books
• 2 psychological sessions/month with Terapify
• Baubap Free Loan

job_description:
Key Objectives

The LATAM D&A team is looking for a Data Analyst. The candidate will bring knowledge and expertise in Advanced Analytics to Chubb. Position will be based in CDMX.

Major Duties and Responsibilities
• Lead the creation of advanced analytics solutions to help us drive profitability and growth by optimizing resources and pricing.
• Own the end-to-end development of the data analytics products: data exploration, modeling and model deployment.
• Develop company A/B testing frameworks and test model quality.
• Understand and combine data from various sources to create analytics data sets.
• Introduce new methodologies, algorithms, tools, and technologies to solve problems.
• Collaborate with multiple teams (e.g., Applied AI, Claims, Underwriting, IT) to achieve objectives.
• Become a trusted partner for the stakeholders in topics related to data and analytics (i.e., translating data insights into business decisions/actions).
• Communicate and present findings or data science projects/achievements to non-technical audiences.
• Support ad-hoc business requests which require statistical analysis. Provide training guidance and assistance to colleagues.

Desired Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Analytics, Engineering or Computer Science. An advanced degree in Statistics or Predictive Analytics is strongly preferred.
• 4+ years of advanced analytics experience.
• Experience with Excel is required.
• Experience with programming and statistical packages (Python, R).
• Experience in data management (SQL).
• Knowledge of advanced analytics techniques.
• Good Problem-Solving skill is a must.
• Communication to different audiences (operations and senior leadership).
• Experience in designing and building data science products that influence the business decision-making process.
• Comprehensive analytics assessments that will help the business leaders to identify and prioritize actions that will help the business to grow in volume and in profitability.
• Translate data driven insights into business decisions and actions.

job_description:
Why Vacasa:

We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we’re the largest full-service vacation rental company in North America thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You’ll fit right in here if you’re curious, entrepreneurial, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.

Why Marketing at Vacasa:

The Marketing team is a growth engine for the company, focussed on innovating, iterating, and learning quickly in service of our customers and cross functional partners. We are storytellers and reputation builders, blending left brain creativity with right brain pragmatism. We have big ambition - to make Vacasa the defining brand in hospitality for vacation rentals. We have a compelling story to tell and are looking for experienced Marketers to get the word out.

What We’re Looking For:

We are looking for an Analyst who is an experienced professional with a demonstrated background in analytics, BI Tools, dashboarding, writing queries, and model building. This Analyst - Revenue Data will have a direct impact on the revenue reporting for thousands of client homes.

The primary purpose of this job is to create the data sources and visualizations which influence stakeholder decisions that lead to the maximum revenue production for thousands of vacation rental homes. Specifically, the Analyst - Revenue Data builds data structures (SQL, DBT) that influence Revenue Management (RM) teammates and executives; dashboards to track performance across time (Tableau); and custom tooling to best serve RM teammates (Python).

What You’ll Do:
• Create & maintain reports (Tableau)
• Build Revenue and Exception Management models (DBT, Airflow)
• Write/QA ad hoc SQL to address revenue-related requests
• Optimize Snowflake ❄️ performance of our data mart
• Support key stakeholder teams (Yield & Pricing, New Homes, SWAT, Rev. Analysis)
• Develop models for forecasting revenue metrics
• Perform market and revenue share analysis
• Incorporate and leverage new data sets in innovative ways
• Craft new visualizations to demonstrate performance vs competition
• Monitor channel partner performance
• Report on rate change events through time
• Optimize all-in pricing across 3rd party channels
• Support yield analyst workflows and tooling
• Develop and monitor success metrics for Revenue Management
• Support acquisition integration and identify opportunity/learnings during integrations (side by side analysis)
• Other duties, as assigned

What You’ll Need:
• Reliable internet connection

Skills and Qualifications:

Technical Skills
• Positive mindset
• Client service mindset
• Relentless
• Strong with SQL (logic, CTEs, Create, Performance optimization)
• Model building (staging, intermediate, presentation layer) (DBT)
• Tableau workbook experience
• Ability to analyze numerical data in both raw and graphical form
• Understanding of Revenue Management concepts
• Thoroughness and due diligence
• Accounting fundamentals
• Attention to detail
• Collaboration with peers
• Completes tasks completely and at high quality
• Ability to distill complex topics and communicate their essence simply
• MS Office, Google Suite required
• Influencing and leadership skills
• Bilingual English / Spanish required.

Compensation
• $774000 - $85900 MXN / year

What You'll Get
• Career advancement opportunities
• Employee discounts
• All the equipment you’ll need to be successful
• Great colleagues and culture
• Hybrid work (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday in office; Within Mexico)
• Extended Health Benefits

Vacasa is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against applicants based upon race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or other classes protected by applicable law. Veterans are encouraged.

Vacasa is committed to maintaining a safe and productive work environment. Possession, use, or being under the influence of alcohol or illegal drugs in the workplace is prohibited.

An offer of employment for this role will be contingent upon the successful completion of an OFAC screening.

job_description:
Overview

Emerge is seeking a
Data Analyst to work with our client who is a technology company with a public
safety mission. Through relentless innovation and discovery, they are
strengthening trust, safety, and transparency across the student transportation
space and making the trip to and from school safer for students.

As
part of the broader Data team encompassing data engineering, data
visualization, and data science, the Data Analyst will be responsible for
leveraging our data to help solve business challenges. This
role will be primarily focused on supporting our diverse customer base which
includes political officials, law enforcement officers, courts, and school
districts. You will partner closely with the Customer Success and Law
Enforcement Liaison teams to both build standardized client reporting for use
across the full client base, as well as respond quickly and accurately to
unique asks from the clients themselves. As an expert on our internal data set
as it relates to the client experience, you will be a chief point of contact
for complex reporting projects and analyses which you will own from start to
finish. This role works directly with the business, understanding what needs to
be asked and the best way to provide information and define business metrics.
You will also help support existing reporting through checks, updates, and
routine maintenance.

Job Responsibilities
• Understand the specific needs of our diverse set of clients, which vary from program to program as well as type of client
• Build deep knowledge of relevant internal and external data repositories
• Work collaboratively with the Customer Success (CS) and Law Enforcement Liaison (LEL) teams to dissect client needs and rapidly iterate on report and feature development
• Use analytics and data visualization skills to build straightforward, accurate, and easily comprehensible reports to satisfy our client base
• Respond to ad-hoc requests for information and analyses and be able to use your knowledge and intuition to highlight what is important and/or questionable
• Use data and programming skills to transform and manipulate data sources as needed
• Understand stakeholder needs and translate them; understand what customers are asking for, where to find data and deliver it in a consumable way
• Work with sometimes unstructured or inconsistent data and understand how it is generated

Qualifications
• Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Information Systems, or equivalent experience
• 2+ years previous experience
serving on an Analytics team, particularly focused on product-related
metrics like customer experience, feature performance, and website
analytics
• 2+ years of experience writing
complex SQL queries
• 2+ years of advanced experience with Tableau (e.g. table calcs, LOD's, relationships)
• Proficient in Report Design and Data Analysis
• Demonstrated ability to
communicate effectively with all project stakeholders, including executive
leadership, business subject area leaders, and project staff
• Strong business acumen and
ability to quickly understand what is important to the business and when
results look incorrect
• Ability to work sometimes without clear direction in times of uncertainty and ambiguity
• Understanding of data
extraction mechanisms, data warehousing, and ETL concepts
• Strong analytical,
troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills in data-related projects
• Experience with data
visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Mode, or Power BI

Work
Environment
• Remote; work from home
role
• Monday-Friday work
week, 8-5pm Eastern or Central Time

Emerge seeks, in all its operations, to employ individuals for
available positions based on their qualifications, working knowledge, and
competency. Emerge has a continuing commitment to ensure that fair and equal
employment opportunities are extended to all qualified persons without regard
to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin,
ethnicity, alienage, citizenship or immigration status, age, mental or physical
disability, medical condition, pregnancy, military/veteran status, predisposing
genetic characteristics, familial status, marital status, domestic violence
victim status, or based on their relationship or association with members of a
protected class or any other protected classification, in accordance with
applicable federal, state and local laws.. Emerge is committed to diversity in
its most inclusive sense.

By
completing an application with us, you seek to join a team of hardworking
professionals dedicated to consistently deliver outstanding service to our
customers and contribute to the financial success of the organization, its clients,
and its employees. Equal access to programs, services and employment is
available to all qualified persons. Those applicants requiring accommodation to
complete the application and/or interview process should contact our Emerge
Recruitment Office.

job_description:
At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. By joining our team of nearly 14,000 associates, you will become part of a community that will help you to succeed. We champion you because when you succeed, we do too. Embark on a new initiative, explore a fresh approach, and take license to think big, so we can all continuously improve. We enable your best to power our future.

What would make me a great candidate?

You enjoy the fundamentals of survey research and data analysis. You understand the basics of sample frames, plans, estimation and selection in the research cycle. You’re curious about local market population nuances, and how to adapt to meet the goals for each local area. You’re excited to improve the current tools with automation.

What would I do?
• Support and enhance existing sampling processes.
• Estimate sample needs by reviewing performance metrics.
• Select sample records based on specifications.
• Complete recurring operational tasks.
• Monitor data collection to ensure study is progressing as planned and meeting timelines, and that quota groups are being met.
• Develop, test, and maintain sampling applications in Python.
• Extract data from platforms using SQL.
• Utilizes tools such as Python, Tableau, SAS, etc. to perform complex data analysis, develop tools for automating procedures, and create visualizations to deliver insights into survey performance.

Is this for me?
• Bachelor’s degree
• At least 3-4 years of relevant research and data analytics experience
• Knowledge of survey sampling methodologies and data collection techniques
• Well-organized and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously
• Demonstrated success and effectiveness working in a time-critical production environment
• Expertise in analytics programming languages, such as Python (with Pandas) and R
• Basic experience in SQL or PySpark.
• Proficiency in MS Office suite and/or Google Office Apps
• Familiarity with BI, Spotfire, Tableau or other data visualization software and techniques
• Excellent English and Spanish oral and written communication skills.

job_description:
Who we are?

Payclip is changing the way payments work in Mexico! We are empowering people to exchange value directly from a mobile device. Clip enables anyone to accept card payments, at any time, and anywhere by turning your smartphone or tablet into a card terminal. We're a well-funded quickly growing FinTech startup. We are the leaders in our market and are accelerating to extend our lead and move into new markets.

The Role

We are looking for an *Data &Analytics Specialist FS* to be part of this amazing fast-growing Fintech, being part of our Financial Services team. At Clip He/She will play an important role in driving data-driven decision-making and providing insights to optimize our financial services offerings.

He/She collaborates with cross-functional teams, and contributes to the development of analytics strategies, reports and solutions tailored specifically to the financial services sector.

What will I be doing?
• Collaborate closely with the Financial Services team, product analysts, risk analysts, and operations, to identify business challenges and opportunities and develop analytical solutions
• Develop and execute the analytics strategy for the Financial Services division, aligned with the company's overall goals and objectives
• Play a role in the collection, analysis, validation and interpretation of sales and digital data
• Exploratory Data Analysis - conduct exploratory analyses to identify patterns, trends, and relevant insights
• Analyze large datasets related to financial transactions, customer behavior, and risk factors to extract actionable insights and support decision-making processes
• Design and maintain effective data reporting and visualization frameworks, ensuring that key metrics and performance indicators are accurately tracked and communicated to stakeholders

Ideal Candidate
• Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as finance, technology, economics, statistics, mathematics, or a related discipline
• Proven experience of 5+ years in an analytics role, preferably expertise in the financial services or fintech industry
• Strong knowledge in data analytics and data architecture
• Experience in data presentations and insights definition

Technical:
• Proficiency in utilizing analytical tools and programming languages such as Python, SQL, Tableau, Google Analytics, POWER BI or similar platforms
• Desirable knowledge of financial services products, industry trends, and regulatory frameworks
• Experience working with large datasets and utilizing databases and data warehouses, with Snowflake, BigQuery and Databricks
• Create predictive and prescriptive models
• Clean, transform, and organize datasets to ensure quality and consistency
• Develop and maintain automatically dashboards for stakeholders

In Clip, we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Clip does not discriminate under any basis of origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, disability, age or other legal status. Clip is an equal opportunity employer.

If you are unstoppable, creative and have the skills we need, we want to hear from you!

apply_options: [{'publisher': 'Jobvite', 'apply_link': 'https://jobs.jobvite.com/scopely/job/o89Jqfwa', 'is_direct': False}, {'publisher': 'Levels.fyi', 'apply_link': 'https://www.levels.fyi/jobs?jobId=114961597400523462', 'is_direct': False}, {'publisher': 'Kit Empleo', 'apply_link': 'https://www.kitempleo.com.mx/empleo/92996091/exl-293-senior-data-analyst-marketing-analytics-xico/', 'is_direct': False}]
job_description:
Scopely is looking for a Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics to join our MAX gaming division in our Mexico City studio hub on a hybrid basis.

Welcome to MAX, a Division of global gaming giant, Scopely – where gaming legends are reborn and new ones are made. We are home to celebrated classics such as Tiki Tripeaks Solitaire, Bingo Bash, Classic Casino, The Walking Dead, and Looney Tunes. At MAX, we’re not just reminiscing; we’re revolutionizing. Our ambitious, genre-bending project in development is set to redefine the gaming landscape. Join MAX, and be at the forefront of shaping the future of mobile gaming.

At Scopely, we care deeply about what we do and want to inspire play, every day - whether in our work environments alongside our talented colleagues, or through our deep connections with our communities of players. We are a global team of game lovers who are developing, publishing and innovating the mobile games industry, connecting millions of people around the world daily.

What You Will Do
• Work collaboratively with Marketing teams to deliver actionable insights into our games to further increase user acquisition, engagement and monetisation.
• Develop data collection systems & strategies to optimise statistical efficiency & data quality
• Proactively perform a wide range of analyses to identify/interpret trends, issues, and opportunities across UA & Marketing
• Answer marketing-related questions & generate marketing reports through exploratory data analyses and ad-hoc reporting
• Design and implement advanced statistical testing for specific problem-solving needs (e.g. A/B testing)

What We’re Looking For
An experienced Analyst with a passion for gaming and a great understanding of free-to-play gaming who is energetic, enthusiastic, well-organised and collaborative in your approach to Analytics. You’ll have:
• A positive attitude and open-minded approach
• Degree in Analytics, Business Intelligence, Finance, Statistics or Computer Science, or other analytical discipline
• 4+ years of experience as a data or financial Analyst applying statistical analysis to B2C consumer behaviours (mobile apps, advertising, market activities)
• Experience in social free-to-play gaming
• Outstanding problem-solving skills, including the ability to:
• Analyse situations and determine the best metrics for a situation
• Conceptualise player behaviours based on data
• Identify meaningful proxies of player behaviours where data doesn’t exist
• Strong work ethic, intellectual curiosity, and drive to complete projects
• Experience using SQL, including complex queries from multiple data sources
• Experience creating, operating and analysing multiple simultaneous A/B tests
• Strong communication and presentation skills, including extensive use of chart and table tools
• Ability to understand and act on changing priorities, and execute multiple competing projects based on business case and expected impact
• Familiarity with data and BI presentation tools (Looker/Google Sheets or equivalent)
• Strong English language skills are required for this role as we have a highly diverse and global business

Bonus Points
• 2+ year’s experience (video gaming, e-commerce, consumer entertainment, etc.)
• Experience with Python, R
• A passion for playing world class mobile, social and casual games a huge plus
• Experience in making world-class social/casual/casino games a huge plus

At Scopely, we create games for everyone - and want to ensure that the people behind our games reflect that! We are committed to creating a diverse, supportive work environment where everyone is treated with respect. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome individuals from all backgrounds to join us & embrace the adventure!

About Us
Scopely is a global interactive entertainment and mobile-first video game company, home to many top, award-winning experiences such as "MONOPOLY GO!," “Star Trek™ Fleet Command,” “Stumble Guys,” “MARVEL Strike Force,” and “Yahtzee® With Buddies,” among others.

Scopely creates, publishes, and live-operates immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer™ experience across multiple platforms--from mobile, web, PC and beyond.
Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform Playgami that supports one of the most diversified portfolios in the games industry.

Recognized multiple times as one of Fast Company’s “World’s Most Innovative Companies,” Scopely is a multi-billion-dollar business due to its ability to create long-lasting game experiences that players enjoy for years.

Scopely has global operations in more than a dozen markets across Asia, EMEA, and North America, and is home to many internal game development teams, referred to as Scopely Studios, with additional game studio partners across four continents.

Scopely was acquired by Savvy Games Group in July 2023 for $4.9 billion, and is now an independent subsidiary of Savvy.

For more information on Scopely, visit: scopely.com.

Notice to candidates: Scopely, Inc and its affiliates will never request payment or ask for financial information as a condition for applying to a position or receiving an offer of employment. All official Scopely, Inc. recruiters only use email domains that end with @scopely.com.

Our official website is www.scopely.com. Please only apply to positions posted on our official website and ensure the recruiter only communicates via the official email domain.

Should you have any questions or encounter any fraudulent requests/emails/websites, please immediately contact recruiting@scopely.com.

job_description: USA Clinics Group is growing and looking to add a Data Analyst to our team! The Data Analyst will report to the Chief Information Officer and provide support to clinical staff and the revenue cycle department by identifying issues with EMR and automated processes. The goal for this position will be to analyze and provide timely resolution for various issues related, but not limited to scheduling, billing, and staff availability.ON SITE, TIJUANA, BAJA CALIFORNIA, MX.Responsibilities:Data analysts collect data, such as clinical information - appointments, encounters, medical findings, or billing information-balances, patient responsibilities, and payments to help companies make the right decisions. This work encompasses several duties and responsibilities, including: Work with executives and other business leaders to identify opportunities for improvement Create reports for internal teams Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions Structure large data sets to find usable information Work with a team of analysts and other associates to process information Create presentations and reports bases on recommendations and findings Requirements Coding skills in SQL language (MS SQL Server, MYSQL) Experience in healthcare field is a plus Analytical and problem-solving skills Knowledge of data gathering, cleaning and transforming techniques Reporting a data visualization skills using software like SSRS Understanding of data warehousing and ETL techniques Proficiency in Microsoft Excel Ability to set and meet deadlines Ability to work in high-pressure situations Experience with statistical software Technical writing skills Excellent attention to detail Strong written/verbal communication skills Ability to QA and troubleshoot data Benefits IMSS 100% Vacation (after the first year) Christmas bonus Paid training Weekends off Mexican holidays off

job_description:
Purpose

The Data Analyst ART interprets data collected from Acoustic Resonance Technology for the purposes of detecting, identifying, and sizing: metal loss, mid-wall (I.e., laminations and inclusions), and geometry features (pipe out-of-roundness) using specialized software and multiple sources of information (I.e., drawings, schematics, pipe tallies, etc.), under the constant supervision of individuals qualified for the task(s) being performed.

Responsibilities

Identifies and carries-out feature/anomaly recognition of pipeline data (identification, classification, and sizing)
Identifies girth welds, longitudinal seam welds, and spiral welds applicable to the data set
Identifies pipeline installations and appurtenances
Establishes and validates reference points
Identifies wall thickness changes
Correlates, aligns, and ties-in customer maps, logs, alignment sheets or PODs to the data and creates a tally register
Interprets Above Ground Markers (AGM) information – applies, edits, and generates location reference listing for this data

Requirements/Education

Must possess a High School Diploma
An associate degree from a technical college is preferred
Minimum 6 months of work experience in any field
Bachelor's degree in engineering or graduate level degree in exact sciences (Metallurgical, Geophysics, Petroleum, Mechanical, Electrical, etc.) preferred
Basic understanding of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook)
Ability to read, write and speak in both English and Spanish (ENGLISH CV/Resume required)

job_description:
We are seeking a talented Data Analyst, who will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets to provide valuable insights and support informed decision-making. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements, design data models, and develop reports and visualizations. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to data-driven strategies and drive business growth.

Responsibilities:
• Collect, clean, and transform raw data from various sources for analysis.
• Perform data exploration, statistical analysis, and data mining to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
• Develop and maintain data models and databases to ensure data accuracy and accessibility.
• Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present findings and communicate data-driven insights to stakeholders.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements and define key performance indicators (KPIs).
• Conduct ad-hoc data analysis and provide recommendations for process improvements and optimizations.
• Perform data validation and quality assurance to ensure data integrity and reliability.
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and data visualization techniques.
• Collaborate with IT teams to implement data governance and security measures.

Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
• Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
• Proficient in SQL and data analysis tools (e.g., Python, R, Excel, Tableau).
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with large and complex datasets.
• Knowledge of data modeling concepts and database management systems.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively communicate insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Attention to detail and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
• Familiarity with data visualization best practices and tools.
• Experience with machine learning and predictive analytics is a plus.

job_description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.

When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the mic and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

Research Analyst

Why We Have This Role

In this role, you will be part of the growing Qualtrics market research community that helps some of the world’s top minds take their research to the next level. You'll be challenged in partnership with a Research Manager to come up with new and creative solutions to our clients’ most difficult research needs.

The Research Analyst plays a key role during the all or part of the lifecycle of impactful research projects for strategically important clients.

How You’ll Find Success
• Effective project management and exceptional organizational skills
• Strong commitment to customer satisfaction
• Establishing and maintaining relationships with clients, track project progress, and ensure timely delivery of research deliverables
• Expertise in managing research projects and meeting client expectations will be crucial to your success

How You’ll Grow
• Opportunity to expand your project management skills, gain in-depth knowledge of research methodologies, and enhance your leadership abilities.
• Structured Promotion Process
• Career Action Planning with Manager
• Qmobility

Things You’ll Do
• Support a successful launch by helping to select the appropriate research methodology to meet the client’s research objectives.
• Assist in the development of the research questionnaire using Qualtrics technology platform. Work with clients to design survey instruments that meet their research objectives and conform to best practices in survey methodology
• Work closely with internal and external resources to ensure successful execution of the fieldwork and data collection.
• Assist in reviewing the collected data and create the analysis and reporting that provides meaningful insights to the sponsoring client.

What We’re Looking For On Your Resume
• A minimum of 1 to 4 years within the custom Market Research industry
• Academic and practical experience with a wide array of product, brand, and advertising research methodologies
• Experience as part of complex research projects (from design through analysis)
• Analytical skills with experience in statistical modeling and analysis.
• Proficient with Excel and PowerPoint
• Bachelor's or advanced degree in business, mathematics, or the sciences.
• Comfortable in a fast-pace, unstructured, and highly competitive environment
• Ability to communicate clearly and pleasantly through both written and spoken mode
• Proficiency in English (written & oral)

What You Should Know About This Team

Our research services team is a collaborative and supportive group of professionals dedicated to delivering high-quality results to our clients. We foster a culture of open communication, innovation, and knowledge sharing. You will have the opportunity to work closely with subject matter experts and contribute to groundbreaking research initiatives.

Our Team’s Favorite Perks and Benefits
• Work-life integration: frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours
• Qualtrics Experience Program: $1,500 for an experience of your choosing (eligible after a year)
• Creative office design fostering innovation and collaboration
• Comprehensive benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc.)

The Qualtrics Hybrid Work Model: Our hybrid work model is elegantly simple: we all gather in the office three days a week; Mondays and Thursdays, plus one day selected by your organizational leader. These purposeful in-person days in thoughtfully designed offices help us do our best work and harness the power of collaboration and innovation. For the rest of the week, work where you want, owning the integration of work and life.

Qualtrics is an equal opportunity employer meaning that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

​​​​​​​Applicants in the United States of America have rights under Federal Employment Laws:Family & Medical Leave Act,Equal Opportunity Employment,Employee Polygraph Protection Act

Qualtrics is committed to the inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Qualtrics will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please let your Qualtrics contact/recruiter know.

Not finding a role that’s the right fit for now? Qualtrics Insiders is the one-stop shop for all things Qualtrics Life. Sign up for exclusive access to content created with you in mind and get the scoop on what we have going on at Qualtrics - upcoming events, behind the scenes stories from the team, interview tips, hot jobs, and more. No spam - we promise! You'll hear from us two times a month max with fresh, totally tailored info - so be sure to stay connected as you explore your best role and company fit.

job_description:
Let’s be unstoppable together!

Circana (formerly IRI and NPD) is the leading advisor on the complexity of consumer behavior. Through unparalleled technology, advanced analytics, cross-industry data, and deep expertise, we provide clarity that helps almost 7,000 of the world’s leading brands and retailers take action and unlock business growth. We understand more about the complete consumer, the complete store, and the complete wallet so our clients can go beyond the data to apply insights, ignite innovation, meet consumer demand, and outpace the competition.

At Circana, we are fueled by our passion for continuous learning and growth, we seek and share feedback freely, and we celebrate victories both big and small in an environment that is flexible and accommodating to our work and personal lives. We have a global commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion as we believe in the undeniable strength that diversity brings to our business, employees, clients, and communities (with us you can always bring your full self to work). Join our inclusive, committed team to be a challenger, own outcomes, and stay curious together. Learn more at www.circana.com.

What will you be doing?

The department will be responsible for developing and maintaining strong IT and technical relationships with our participating retailers across LATAM as well as other internal operations partners to ensure information data flow:
• Deliver retailer data files on an agreed weekly delivery schedule.
• Deliver retailer files that conform with the necessary data feed structure and content.
• Provide Circana with advance notice of any changes to retailer data feeds so that Circana can prepare for those changes.
• Deliver data files that are free from errors.
• Work with Circana to urgently resolve any queries about the data that may arise during the production process.

Job Responsibilities
• Working with Circana’s Global Operations departments to align data receipt processes in LATAM with Circana’s global processes and, where relevant, determining how processes need to be adapted to fit with the specific circumstances of the business in LATAM.
• Collaborating with Circana’s different operations and client-facing departments to contribute to an overall positive relationship with Retailers/Clients.
• Review classification and dictionary maintenance of certain items/industries.
• Execute and build pre-production and production reports.
• Working with IT and technical teams at retailers to:
• Secure additional data sources to facilitate the production process (e.g. buy lists, new products)
• Maintain proactive communication with retailers to gain upfront visibility on changes to data feeds.
• Lead onboarding sessions with relevant retailer team members.
• Lead diagnosis with retailers to evaluate and resolve data issues that arise during production.
• Conduct data reviews during the production process.

Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree preferably in Industrial Engineering, Business Operations, Data science, or similar.
• 1+ years of experience with data analysis, ideally data feed management and client services.
• 1+ years of direct or indirect Retail Industry business operations experience.
• Knowledge and experience in managing retailer data, file conversion, etc.
• Proficient in MS Office Excel, PowerPoint, and Word (Access or SQL is a plus).
• Capacity to work with a high volume of data and develop and maintain relationships with clients.
• Ability to make clear decisions where required, but also co-exist within a team environment and understand role within the broader data production process.
• Able to work fluently in English in technical and business discussions (Both written and verbal)
• Portuguese is a plus.

Circana Behaviors

As well as the technical skills, experience, and attributes that are required for the role, our shared behaviors sit at the core of our organization. Therefore, we always look for people who can continuously champion these behaviors throughout the business within their day-to-day role:
• Stay Curious: Being hungry to learn and grow, always asking the big questions
• Seek Clarity: Embracing complexity to create clarity and inspire action
• Own the Outcome: Being accountable for decisions and taking ownership of our choices
• Center on the Client: Relentlessly adding value for our customers
• Be a Challenger: Never complacent, always striving for continuous improvement
• Champion Inclusivity: Fostering trust in relationships engaging with empathy, respect and integrity
• Commit to each other: Contributing to making Circana a great place to work for everyone

Location: This position can be located in the following area(s): Mexico City, Mexico. You will be required to visit the Circana office in Mexico City one week per month.

#LI-JP1

job_description:
The Data/Information Mgt Analyst 2 is a developing professional role. Applies specialty area knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. Identifies policy gaps and formulates policies. Interprets data and makes recommendations. Researches and interprets factual information. Identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. Integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.

Responsibilities:
• This function covers incumbents responsible for various data activities, which include database administration, data analysis, maintenance, data quality, and database management or database architecture / design engineering
• Responsible for routine operational or administrative work
• Day-to-day actions are focused on administering defined procedures, analyses and report preparation
• Individuals will have their work thoroughly reviewed and checked by more senior incumbents and will have limited contact outside their immediate area
• Daily deliverable of routine and defined outputs, while at the same time developing knowledge of the broader context in which the work is being performed
• Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:
• 0-2 years relevant experience
• Know-how on analytic tools (SAS E-miner, Knowledge Seeker, SPSS etc.)
• Big data and machine learning experiences are (R, Python etc.)
• The ability to engage resources outside of their direct control to achieve objectives

Education:
• Bachelors/University degree or equivalent experience

This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Responsabilidades:
• Esta función cubre a los titulares a cargo de diversas actividades de datos, incluida la administración de base de datos, análisis de datos, mantenimiento, calidad de datos y gestión de base de datos o arquitectura de base de datos/ingeniería de diseño.
• Realiza trabajo administrativo u operativo de rutina.
• Realiza acciones cotidianas enfocadas en la administración de procedimientos, análisis y preparación de informes definidos.
• Un titular con mayor nivel jerárquico revisará y verificará el trabajo de la persona con detenimiento y tendrá contacto limitado fuera de su área inmediata.
• Evaluar adecuadamente el riesgo cuando se toman decisiones comerciales, demostrando una consideración particular por la reputación de la empresa y protegiendo a Citigroup, sus clientes y activos, al impulsar el cumplimiento de las leyes, las reglas y los reglamentos correspondientes, acatando la política, aplicando un juicio ético sólido en relación con el comportamiento personal, la conducta y las prácticas comerciales y escalando, administrando e informando los problemas de control con transparencia

Calificaciones:
• Capacidad de pensar de forma estratégica y de relacionarse con recursos fuera de su control directo para lograr objetivos.
• Conocimiento sólido de herramientas analíticas.
• Conocimiento de procesos operativos (elementos básicos, flujos, documentación).
• Experiencias de aprendizaje con máquinas y datos masivos (análisis de datos)

Educación:
• Licenciatura/título universitario o experiencia equivalente.

job_description:
OTA-LAD-MX

Would you like to contribute your own ideas on how to smartly deploy and manage large scale distributed Database-as-a-Service offerings for the public and private clouds? Oracle’s Database development group designs and develops the Database-as-a-Service platform that drives Oracle's Database, Engineered Systems, Oracle Public & Private Clouds, Oracle PaaS, and SaaS offerings. This team is a provider of public cloud database and infrastructure management software and helps companies manage platform resources to deliver service, quality, and availability, as well as workloads in private and hybrid cloud environments.

The Database Cloud Platform team is responsible for designing, developing and delivering the Oracle Database product on Public Cloud Platforms. These range from initial provisioning of customer’s database and compute environment to complete life-cycle management of the customer’s database instance on the Oracle Public Cloud. The Database on Public Cloud product is growing rapidly and the product features are designed to manage customer environments at a massive scale. The same architecture is deployed and managed for private clouds for our customers. This is a global team with locations in US, Mexico Development Center, and Oracle’s India Development Centre (IDC) Bangalore.

job_description:
About the Role

The Sales and Success Operations team's mission is to be the primary support function for our GTM teams globally. We support and enable frontline GTM teams to sell, service more efficiently and optimally by providing strategic direction and reducing friction in the GTM process.

The right candidate will help us provide more transparency, direction and strategic oversight analytics, forecasting and pipeline management to unlock more GBs (Gross Bookings) for Uber for Business!

What you'll do:
• Own sales planning, semi-annual quota planning, and other planning cadences in partnership with Finance to ensure achievement of revenue and key operating metrics
• Conduct MBRs/QBRs with leadership, optimally communicate analysis results
• Establish and manage key sales performance dashboards
• Influence and enforce rules of engagement across selling teams, handle disputes and overcome conflicts around territories and attainment crediting
• Recommend actions for sales improvement and work together to integrate positive changes within the operational environment
• Provide analytical and operational support to continuously improve our forecasting and pipeline management and methodologies
• Work on special projects such as process improvement and assisting in testing for change of business requirements
• Implement and maintain business solutions and recommendations to improve performance

What you'll need:
• 3+ years of strategy and operations experience with 1 years of meaningful experience in Sales Operations
• Sophisticated SQL or Python skills to handle large sets of unstructured data and synthesizing into business insights using Excel or Google Suite
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a relevant discipline (Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, etc.)
• Proficient in English
• Experience using Tableau for data visualization
• Familiarity with Salesforce.com or other CRMs
• Experience with forecasting
• Excellent analytical skills and intuition for business. Passionate about framing business questions with data, translating business needs into strategies, and carrying out tactics and process improvements

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form (https://forms.gle/aDWTk9k6xtMU25Y5A).

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber's cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.
• Accommodations may be available based on religious and/or medical conditions, or as required by applicable law. To request an accommodation, please reach out to accommodations@uber.com.

job_description:
Data Solutioning Analyst

Job ID

149575

Posted

18-Jan-2024

Service line

GWS Segment

Role type

Full-time

Areas of Interest

Customer Service, Data & Analytics, Engineering/Maintenance, Project Management

Location(s)

Polanco - Ciudad de Mexico - Mexico, San Jose - San Jose - Costa Rica

Data Solutioning Analyst

CBRE is the world’s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm. We’re looking for a Data Solutioning Analys t who seekscontinuous development and professional challenges.

If you have a business vision, continuous improvement, a sense of urgency, proactivity and an excellent attitude, this is for you.

Duties:
• Support the solutioning process by analyzing, conditioning, collecting, and evaluating client-provided asset, work order, site, sf, and property data.
• Build data-driven solutioning tools for all IFM services lines considering regional and country differences, benchmarks, local safety and compliance regulations, and input from a Global Solution Architect team.
• Provide a “first draft” solution from client provided data for Technical Services, Smart FM, Sustainability, Workplace Experience, and other IFM solutioning using country level benchmarks, client account data, and feedback from a global solution architect team.
• Run complex analysis to model several solutioning scenarios representing various solutions so that sales and solutions team are able to validate competitiveness of the solution.
• Work with a team to define the requirements of a client solution, understand the solutioning assumptions required to create a solution, gain feedback on the proposed solution, and refine the draft to achieve the stated goals.
• Ability to create baseline assumptions for facility management budgets based on experience working within a facility management profession.
• Calculate savings across a facility management budget using services provided by CBRE in technical solutions, third party procurement, etc.
• Utilisation of Power BI/ power apps to provide visual representation of statistics in a logical and understandable way that can be used by global and regional teams.
• Support with the creation of tools and processes to provide competitive solutions

Knowledge, Skills & Experience:
• Fully bilingual (English & Spanish)
• At least three years’ experience as a data analyst or working in a role that required significant data analytical requirements.
• Experience working with sales or procurement functions would be beneficial but not required.
• Experience within the facilities management industry is preferred.
• Strong time management and prioritization skills
• Ability to work in a high-pressure environment.
• Excellent attention to detail
• Strong analytical skills
• Proven experience – Intermediate / Advanced Microsoft Excel capabilities
• Experience with Power BI Dashboards
• Ability to work quickly in both high pressure environments and where target delivery dates are key to success

CBRE is committed to offer equal opportunities in all our labor processes, exercising a culture of inclusion and non-discrimination, we make labor decisions based on merit and without taking any factors such as race, color, nationality, religion, sex or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability etc.

CBRE, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer (Women/Minorities/Persons with Disabilities/US Veterans)

job_description:
At PVH Corp, we are looking for an ambitious and analytical Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, organizing, and analyzing large data sets to identify trends, correlations, and opportunities for improvement. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of data visualization and analytics tools, as well as exceptional problem-solving skills. If you are an organized and results-driven professional looking to join a fast-paced and innovative organization, we would love to hear from you!Qualifications• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field• At least 3 years of experience in data analysis and reporting• Advanced proficiency in Excel and other data analysis and visualization tools• Strong knowledge of data mining and statistical analysis• Excellent written and verbal communication skills• Ability to work independently and in a team environment

Responsibilities:

• Collect, organize, and analyze large data sets to identify trends, correlations, and opportunities for improvement.
• Utilize data analysis and visualization tools such as Excel to create reports and dashboards.
• Implement data mining and statistical analysis methods to generate insights.
• Develop and maintain effective relationships with stakeholders.
• Present data analysis results in a clear and concise manner.
• Identify and recommend solutions to improve data accuracy and performance.
• Work collaboratively with team members to ensure on-time completion of projects.
• Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization.

PVH Corp is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
